bugs.title: weechat fails to install on RHEL 7.2

bugzilla.short_desc: weechat fails to install on RHEL 7.2

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,

Basically, weechat doesn't install on a brand new RHEL 7.2 (tried with epel-testing enabled to see, but no change).

$ sudo yum install weechat
Loaded plugins: langpacks, product-id, search-disabled-repos, subscription-manager
Resolving Dependencies
--> Running transaction check
---> Package weechat.x86_64 0:1.3-1.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: libguile-2.0.so.22(GUILE_2.0)(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libv8.so.3()(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libtcl8.5.so()(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libruby.so.2.0()(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libguile-2.0.so.22()(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libgc.so.1()(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Running transaction check
---> Package gc.x86_64 0:7.2d-7.el7 will be installed
---> Package ruby-libs.x86_64 0:2.0.0.598-25.el7_1 will be installed
---> Package tcl.x86_64 1:8.5.13-8.el7 will be installed
---> Package v8.x86_64 1:3.14.5.10-17.el7 will be installed
---> Package weechat.x86_64 0:1.3-1.el7 will be installed
--> Processing Dependency: libguile-2.0.so.22(GUILE_2.0)(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Processing Dependency: libguile-2.0.so.22()(64bit) for package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64
--> Finished Dependency Resolution
Error: Package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64 (epel)
           Requires: libguile-2.0.so.22()(64bit)
Error: Package: weechat-1.3-1.el7.x86_64 (epel)
           Requires: libguile-2.0.so.22(GUILE_2.0)(64bit)

Ok so the problem is that guile is in some of the server channels, but these aren't in the workstation so I had to recompile guile from the rawhide srpm: http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=11995634

$ python is_it_in_rhel.py guile --channel --release 7
guile is in RHEL 7;   version: 2.0.9;   archs: i686, ppc, ppc64, ppc64le, x86_64;   channels: rhel-7-for-power-optional-rpms, rhel-7-for-powerle-optional-rpms, rhel-7-server-optional-rpms

Hi! Thanks for the bug report.

It installs fine on CentOS 7, but I'm not sure how to resolve this for RH channels. Should I file a bug against component="guile" for product="Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7"?

I have installed weechat in CentOS 7.1.  
But now I am using RHEL 7.2. I updated RHEL 7.2 and then attempted to install it , but it failed. 

https://paste.fedoraproject.org/388553/

Installation of Weechat works on CentOS 7.2. But not in Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.2 (Maipo). 

https://da.gd/FaRvr
FEDORA-EPEL-2022-e8cd6275b1 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2022-e8cd6275b1

FEDORA-EPEL-2022-e8cd6275b1 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2022-e8cd6275b1

FEDORA-EPEL-2022-e8cd6275b1 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2020-9759 weechat: malformed message 352 (who) can cause a NULL pointer dereference in the callback function which could result in a crash. [epel-7]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-9759 weechat: malformed message 352 (who) can cause a NULL pointer dereference in the callback function which could result in a crash. [epel-7]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-9759 weechat: malformed message 352 (who) can cause a NULL pointer dereference in the callback function which could result in a crash.

long_desc.thetext: An issue was discovered in weechat before 2.7.1. A malformed message 352 (who) can cause a NULL pointer dereference in the callback function which could result in a crash

https://weechat.org/doc/security/

bugs.title: CVE-2020-9760 weechat: receiving IRC message 005 with longer nick prefixes could result in buffer overflow and crash [epel-7]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-9760 weechat: receiving IRC message 005 with longer nick prefixes could result in buffer overflow and crash [epel-7]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-9760 weechat: receiving IRC message 005 with longer nick prefixes could result in buffer overflow and crash

long_desc.thetext: An issue was discovered in WeeChat before 2.7.1. When receiving IRC message 005 with longer nick prefixes, a buffer overflow and possibly a crash can happen when a new mode is set for a nick.

Created weechat tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1817399]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1817400]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1817398]

FEDORA-EPEL-2022-e8cd6275b1 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

After changing the options weechat.network.gnutls_ca_system or weechat.network.gnutls_ca_user, the TLS verification function is lost.
Consequently, any connection to a server with TLS is made without verifying the certificate, which could lead to a man-in-the-middle attack.
Connection to IRC servers with TLS is affected, as well as any connection a server made by a plugin or a script using the function hook_connect. 

References:

https://weechat.org/doc/security/WSA-2022-1/

Created weechat tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2063856]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2063855]

bugs.title: CVE-2022-28352 weechat: allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof a TLS chat server [epel-7]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-28352 weechat: allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof a TLS chat server [epel-7]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-28352 weechat: allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof a TLS chat server

long_desc.thetext:
WeeChat (aka Wee Enhanced Environment for Chat) 3.2 to 3.4 before 3.4.1 does not properly verify the TLS certificate of the server, after certain GnuTLS options are changed, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof a TLS chat server via an arbitrary certificate. NOTE: this only affects situations where weechat.network.gnutls_ca_system or weechat.network.gnutls_ca_user is changed without a WeeChat restart.

Reference:

https://weechat.org/doc/security/WSA-2022-1/
https://github.com/weechat/weechat/issues/1763

Created weechat tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2072046]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-7.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

title: weechat-3.6-2.el7
